description.S1: Abernathy is one of the four people Silas sent you to collect from.
description.S2: He's been feeling under the weather and is probably at his residence.

blurb.B1: Martin Abernathy can be found in his home inside Edgewater.
blurb.B2: You can easily talk him into paying you his Gravesite Fee (360xp),
blurb.B3: and he'll give you the Quest: The Long Tomorrow if you agree to help him retrieve the medicine cache from the Community Center,
blurb.B4: as the company policy excludes him from treatment.

description.S1: You finished collecting gravesite fees from the people of Edgewater.

blurb.B1: After gathering all the gravesite fees,
blurb.B2: return to Silas to receive a reward of 300 bits.
blurb.B3: With a Persuade 6 check, Silas will agree to upping the reward by 150 bits.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Whoa! Did - uh - did Mr. Tobson send you?

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: You tell Mr. Tobson I'll be right at my post. Tomorrow. Bright and early, tomorrow. Because I am definitely not plagued. Spry as a spring chicken - that's old Abernathy.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I heard you muttering to yourself.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Didn't nobody ever tell you to never impress yourself between a man and his muttering? Which is, by the way, a normal and healthy mode of expression.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: You wanna mingle, go try the cantina.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm here to collect your gravesite fees.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll leave you be.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Silas knows, doesn't he? That's why he sent you. That's why he wants me to pay up. He knows.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Knows what?

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'm dying. I'm not long for this world. The date of my expiration is fast approaching, and soon I shall be ushered through the great cannery in the skies.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: It's plague. Has to be. Silas knows. He knows I've got one foot in my grave, and now he wants to charge me for the other one.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm sorry to hear that.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You're being paranoid.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm sure it's all very tragic and heartbreaking. Pay me so I can get out of here.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: You are? Oh. Wow. First time anyone's ever told me that.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'll pay your fees. I don't want any trouble from Silas. But if you could see your way to freelancing for me, I could really use the help.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How can I help?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why do you think I'm a freelancer?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Depends on what you need.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You can't afford me.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: There's a cache of anthrocillin tucked away in the old community center. Powerful stuff. Stronger than what we got, anyway.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: I need you to break in, nab that medicine, and bring it back to me.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll do it.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll think about it.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Will you oblige me with your haste? I think I feel the plague spreadin'. Oh Law, it's in my spleen now. I can feel it.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh, hey, I'm sorry. Didn't mean nothing by it. Wasn't trying to insult you.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Never mind. What do you need done?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why would I be insulted?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Don't worry about it.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Couple hours out of your day and some light second-story work. That's all.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: It's just - you ain't one of us. A Spacer, I mean. Stands to reason you've got no company looking after you.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Not your fault, though. Even freelancers gotta eat. And if that means they must scratch some bits out of odd jobs, who am I to judge 'em? Least you're not a deserter.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What kind of odd job are you referring to?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I guess that's fair.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Okay. That is a little insulting.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: So does that mean you're for hire? I could use the help, if you could use the work.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Look. I'm sorry. Never had much in the way of social graces. But the job is a good one, if you're interested.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'll scratch something together for you. Sell off some of my sundry at Moreau's if I have to. Just hear me out.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: I am? Law help me. Paranoia's one of the plague's known symptoms.
